game

Class Game

  • java.lang.Object
    • game.Game

  • @NotNull
public class Game
extends java.lang.Object
    Game class, this class controls the flow of the game
    Version:
    0.5
    Author:
    Dieter Castel, Jonas Devlieghere, Vincent Reniers en Stefan Pante

        Constructs a new board-based game.
        Parameters:
        hSize - the horizontal size of the board
        vSize - the vertical size of the board

        protected Game(Grid grid)
        Constructs a new board-based game with a given grid. Protected for testing purposes.
        Parameters:
        grid - The grid on which the game will be played.

      • isValidCurrentPlayer

      • setCurrentPlayer

        public void setCurrentPlayer(Player currentPlayer)
        Sets the value of the currentPlayer of Game if the given value is valid.
        Parameters:
        currentPlayer - The currentPlayer to set.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the given argument is not a valid currentPlayer. | !isValidCurrentPlayer(currentPlayer)
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the given argument can't be currentPlayer of this game. | !canHaveAsCurrentPlayer(currentPlayer)

      • switchToNextPlayer

        public void switchToNextPlayer()
        Switches player. e.g.: if the current player is the first player, the current player will be set to player 2

      • getCurrentPlayer

@Raw
public Player getCurrentPlayer()

      • getLightTrail

        public LightTrail getLightTrail(Player player)
                         throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Returns the LightTrail associated with the Player.
        Parameters:
        player -
        Returns:
        LightTrail If the player has an associated LightTrail.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - If the player does not have a LightTrail. Or if the player given is null.

      • getLightTrails

        public java.util.HashMap<Player,LightTrail> getLightTrails()

      • getNextPlayer

        public Player getNextPlayer()
        Gets the player instance which isn't the current player. e.g.: If the currentPlayer is player 1, player 2 is returned
        Returns:
        if(currentPlayer == player1) return player2 if(currentPlayer == player2) return player1

      • getOtherPlayers

        Returns all players, except the current player

      • getPlayers

        Returns all players

        Returns all players of this game

      • canHaveAsCurrentPlayer

        public boolean canHaveAsCurrentPlayer(Player currentPlayer)
        Checks whether the given current player is a legal currentPlayer for this game object.
        Parameters:
        currentPlayer - The currentPlayer to check.
        Returns:
        True if the given player is either the first or second player. | (currentPlayer == this.getPlayer1() || currentPlayer == this.getPlayer2())

      • powerFailSquares

        public void powerFailSquares()
        Sets the state of any square to a PowerFailure state with a 5% chance.
